result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
8:40 a.m. Defendant Christopher Owens in court with attorney D. Nicholas Carroll. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CM491 and 16CF267
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF267 Count 1: No Contest
16CF267 Count 2: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CF267.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 15CM491 is dismissed and read in.

ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Carroll concurs with joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT:**PROBATION**
16CF267 Count 1:
I/S Sentence: 9 mo Jail, consecutive with huber 2nd half on Electronic monitor if eligible and approved- stayed
2 yrs Probation
Conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor your compliance. 
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
Pay costs & DNA Surcharge
Provide DNA sample.

16CF267 Count 2:
I/S Sentence:  30 day Jail same jail conditions as count 1, concurrent to count 1, but consecutive to any other sentence being served- stayed
 1 yrs Probation, concurrent
Conditions:
Pay costs & DNA Surcharge
Comple with same conditions as stated in Count 1.
Plea hearing on October 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Cash previously posted: 
5/31/16 Bond amended to add conditions: 
Not commit any new offenses. 
Not possess any drugs or drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Christopher Owens in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
BY THE COURT:  Court quashes the warrant. 

Defendant did not receive a copy of criminal complaint.
2:48 p.m.  Court will recall the case to allow the defendant to review the complaint. 

2:49 p.m.  Court recalls the case.  Appearances remain. 
Defendant received copy of the complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Court enters NOT GUILTY plea on defendant's behalf.
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

State recommends bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher Owens
Current: 724 Division St, Stevens Point, WI 54481   (Effective: 05-31-2016)
Prior: 724 Division St A, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on May 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Owens not in court. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:28 p.m.   Court calls the case. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds complaint shows probable cause.  Criminal warrant.  $100 cash alternative.  Limited to Portage County.
